Stayed about a week
review_text:
What could possibly be added to the raving reviews for this gem of an accomodation?
Located in Audubon, one of the loveliest neighbourhoods around, this is a feast for anyone who likes a stroll, be it in the wonderful park or just meandering around the streets. A lovely, old school supermarket - Langenstein's- is just a few blocks and away (and, being New Orleans, of course they have fresh seafood...) as is the St Charles streetcar.
The carriage house with the lush garden and the refreshing pool (what a gift in this climate!) is the oasis one longs to have in a bustling city like this, having all the amenities one could wish for and then some.
We were here for Jazzfest and couldn't possibly have been happier about everything. Skye is the loveliest and most generous host imaginable and with her crew of husband Rasch and dog-in-chief Olive added in so many ways to our time here - we laughed a lot together and just had the best of times.

review_text:
Skye's New Orleans carriage house is a true treasure, offering an exceptional stay that exceeded our expectations. As an innkeeper, Skye's meticulous touch is evident in every corner - the house is stocked with everything you need - and the well-designed layout allows for seamless transitions between work and relaxation. The property exude coziness, complemented by the charm of fruit trees gracing the outdoor space.
Skye's hospitality is unmatched â€“ prompt responsiveness, local recommendations, and thoughtful gestures like providing blankets for a day at the park or bicycles for neighborhood exploration. The neighborhood itself is both safe and enchanting, with the sweet addition of Olive, Skye's friendly dog.
Our arrival was marked by a charming gift basket. Having lived in New Orleans and visited frequently, I confidently assert that Skye's carriage house is the epitome of a perfect NOLA stay. Whether you're a local or a first-time visitor, this spot is unbeatable. We'll be back!

review_text: Staying in this 1890 carriage house was a pure delight. The space was perfect!The house was overall charming, clean, and comfortable, but of course we came to New Orleans to experience the city. Thankfully, our hosts prepared a helpful binder full of suggestions for local restaurants, nightlife, etc. I always appreciate when hosts do this. Staying in the quiet, beautiful Audubon area allowed us to start each day with a peaceful morning walk around the park. We were less than 10 minutesâ€™ drive from popular Cajun restaurants and some lively streets full of fun shopping and coffee shops. The location was also easily walkable to the Trolley, which allowed direct access to the French Quarter, Bourbon Street, and Frenchman Street. We had a wonderful weekend, and are grateful to our hosts, who were friendly but not overbearing. They made us feel welcome and at home, like we were staying with family. I would recommend this place to anyone visiting the area!

Wonderfully charming carriage house with every amenity and perfectly situated in a quaint part of the Uptown Garden District. We loved being close to Audubon Park, Tulane, St. Charles streetcar, Magazine Street shops and restaurants - it was the perfect location for our visit to NOLA!
The layout of the space is full of light, cozy and functional - a nice, open well-appointed kitchen, comfortable living room and the upstairs bedroom has a nice warm feel â€“ the huge walk-in closet was especially helpful for us.
After going for a run on a day that was a little too hot for exercise the pool was very refreshing, and even when not swimming we enjoyed just lounging on the chairs and enjoying the pretty patio surrounded by numerous nice plants and fruit trees.
Cute lab Olive stole our hearts with her energy and affection (gave us a nice consolation from missing our own dog).
This was one of our most favorite airb&b stays (and weâ€™ve stayed at a lot!). Skye was a fantastic host with great communication, very attentive to all our needs during our stay - went above and beyond which we greatly appreciated.
We will make this our home away from home every time we visit NOLA. We canâ€™t recommend enough. 10 stars!!!!! Thx Skye for welcoming us into your home. We canâ€™t wait to come back!

I stayed 8 days in this gem of a house in uptown New Orleans. Warmly greeted by Skye and Olive (their 2 year old black lab) I settled in for a comfortable stay.
The carriage house is very quaint; tastefully furnished and offers all you need:
- A very comfortable bed; I slept well every evening.
- A kitchen with all necessary appliances and utensils. There were some basics on hand for my first morning: coffee, milk, yoghurt and cereal.
- Bathroom toiletries which were much appreciated.
- Within walking distance to Whole Foods.
- A stones throw from the streetcar (Saint Charles) which will take you to downtown.
- The owners are directly on hand if you have any questions.
If you are looking for an authentic experience in a beautiful part of New Orleans this is the place for you.
Thank you Skye, Rasch and Olive ğŸ¾

review_text: My stay at the coach house was exceptional. It was light-filled, spotless, organized, charmingly decorated & inviting - what a treat to stay in such a beautiful, historic home nestled within a neighborhood of other such homes. Her welcome offering of delicious homemade banana bread and other treats & basics was an unexpected but much appreciated bonus. Skye has seemingly thought of all the amenities and extras one might need in a pinch & perhaps might have forgotten when packing. I told her I wish my own home was so well-equipped and organized! The bed was so comfortable and it was glorious to wake up in that sunny space and hear the pool fountain going! She also provided a comprehensive array of New Orleans guidebooks and a handy binder of recommended local attractions & restaurants which I frequently consulted. The lovely pool is a huge perk - a welcome respite from the heat. And last but certainly not least there was the intermittent company of black lab Olive in the yard - the goodwill ambassador of the place! I loved it all and can't wait to stay again. This summary is long but that's only because there are so many reasons to recommend the coach house!

Would stay here again!
Ramya

Skyeâ€™s carriage house was perfect for our half week getaway to New Orleans. It had the character of a 100yr+ place but the comfort and cleanliness of somewhere new. The location was also perfect (walkable for exploring Magazine St. and the Freret St. neighborhood and very close to the street cars for further treks into the city)!
As far as lodging, the upstairs bedroom was spacious, bright, and super comfortable. We even elected to stay in and cook dinner one night to get some extra time at the pool; the kitchen and living areas were cozy and had everything we needed to do this.
Finally, Skye was great. She was communicative, available, mindful of privacy, and very kind! Her book of recommendations and welcome surprises were added bonuses. We enjoyed meeting her AND Olive. Would 1000% recommend staying here if you have the chance; we certainly will if we have the opportunity again.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Our stay at the Carriage House was nothing short of fantastic. We've stayed at many airbnbs that have been great, with really good hosts, but the Carriage House and Skye was by far one of the best. The location is in a quiet, upscale neighborhood just a short walk away from the St. Charles Streetcar, which will take you to all of the popular areas of New Orleans. The house is located in the back of their main family house, but we immediately felt comfortable and at home. We never felt like we were intruding. The welcome basket with New Orleans touches was the best way to start our weekend getaway. The house is packed with amenities - kitchen, bath, linens, games, books, you name it. It has that classic southern charm but is spotlessly clean (and not haunted, tee hee). If you have a chance to stay here, I highly recommend it for a nice, quiet getaway. Tulane University is very close. Audubon Park is just down the street. We chose the Carriage House for a couple weekend to celebrate a birthday and have a brief escape from the upcoming Chicago winter.

The carriage house had every possible thing we needed with its beautiful french country style. While our son has been in college, we've stayed at over a half dozen air b'bs in NOLA. This is by far our favorite. We plan to return this spring!

name: Christa
rating_info:

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
There are so many great things about this place! First, the location is perfect, in a very walkable area, close to St. Charles with the streetcar that can transport you to the Garden District or French Quarter, and within walking distance to Magazine St., Audubon Park, Tulane and Loyola. The homes in the area are beautiful, and you can spend more than a few mornings or evenings strolling around and letting time slip away!
Next, the carriage home itself is very comfy, a welcoming retreat with a large bedroom and bath on the 2nd level and a well thought-out living space including a half bath on the ground floor. It is a refreshing space, with full kitchen (with window overlooking pool and lemon trees) and comfortable sofa for lounging (or sleeping as it pulls out to a sofa bed). The home is sparkling clean, and fresh! The outdoor space with lovely pool was the perfect place to unwind, and enjoy time with family and friends. We spent an entire day of our long weekend in the pool!
Skye is a gracious host, who has truly thought of everything, including a sweet welcome basket with goodies and yummy New Orleans coffee. There are extra cozy blankets, towels, etc. to make you feel at home as well. We celebrated my daughter's 21st birthday here, and the carriage house was the perfect backdrop for creating memories of a lifetime. We will most certainly visit this wonderful home again!

There are many thoughtful things that made the stay enjoyable, including a helpful collection of books about New Orleans, a wonderful welcoming basket with snacks and wine, and enough food in the refrigerator so we did not have to go out for dinner or breakfast the next day if we were too tired.

review_text: The apartment is spacious and gorgeous! The high ceiling and wooden floors throughout as well as a wide wrap-around balcony give it that typical New Orleans-vibe. Special mentions for the stylish bathroom with a great shower; clean and soft bedding; a victrola player to play some jazz records. It's about a 15-minute walk to the centre of the French quarter, a stroll we much enjoyed as it created a welcome break from the hustle and bustle of Bourbon street. The Marigny neighbourhood is also very picturesque. The building is about a block away from some of the well-known jazz bars on Frenchmen street (Spotted Cat, Maison, ...), which is plenty of distance to avoid hearing music inside the apartment, but light sleepers might want to pack ear plugs as you do hear groups of people making their way to and from these bars. Ayu bakehouse on the ground floor has amazing buns and rolls; there's also a Ruby Slipper Cafe branch nearby. We'll definitely stay here again on our next NOLA visit!

review_text:
The Grand Balcony was a great option for our four person group. There is a coffee spot directly under the apartment. You can walk a couple of blocks to get to major areas. The place was clean, spacious, and comfortable. We spent every night on the balcony listening to the sounds below. It is a city, so you can't except quiet at night. The in-unit washer and dryer was great because you will need to change a few times a day with that heat. Ubers are readily available (1 min arrival).
The linens on the bed were a little uncomfortable --they felt like the towels (starchy basket weave). There may have been softer blankets somewhere but I didn't find them.
The check out procedure asked us to:
turn air to certain degree
leave linens on bed
hang towels in bathroom
run dishwasher
place garbage in foyer
It was easy and reasonable compared to other Airbnbs.
Overall, nice stay!! I would recommend it.

Incredibly high ceilings, a turntable with fun vintage New Orleans vinyl, chic decor. Parking on street easy to find. We were there for Mardi Gras and on Fri and Sat nights there were some cars blasting music that cruised by late into the night, so earplugs might be helpful. Other than that it was quiet - no crowds, etc. Right near Frenchman St and easy walk to the Quarter. Would definitely stay again!

Good windows help keep most of the city at bay, but there is always something going on in the street below. Great bakery located on ground floor. Long, steep staircase to get to the apartment. Will stay here again...and again!

Second story, beautiful, historic home in a great location. Upstairs wrap around porch is awesome, with a view of the park across the street. Easy (walking) access to French quarter, museums, bars etc. Parking was across the street and was fine for us, but I can see how it could be an issue at a busier time of year. There was a problem with the keypad when we arrived, but it was fixed very quickly. Great communication from host. I would gladly stay here again. It was like stepping back in time. If there are any ghosts, they are well-mannered classy ghosts. (We didn't happen across any). Highly recommend.
PS: the bakery downstairs is 100% worth a visit.

I had initially booked a hotel. However I cancelled that as I was travelling with my son and we decided we preferred to have separate bedrooms with plenty of space to chill out.
Turns out we hit the jackpot. The hotel district is way to far away from the best spots. This place, on Frenchmen was just a short two blocks from the best bars and music in town and far enough away to not be affected by the noise.
It was also very close to the main tourist attractions - French Quarter, Steamboat, trolley busses, jazz museum etc without being on top of them.
It also has a v cool balcony that is great to sit out on and is above a very good artisanal bakery. We also loved the retro turntable that we could hook up our phones to via bluetooth to play music.
We hit the jackpot and Kay was extremely helpful for the whole stay. No regrets.

Rating, 4 stars

December 2022
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Oodles of charm and a stellar location - when you are in Kay's place you know you're in New Orleans. High ceilings, tall windows (lots of light), a wrap around porch and hard wood floors. The bathroom has been updated, so it was nice to have a modern shower. Beds were comfy and no complaints about the sheets. Despite the freezing weather outside I was actually too warm with the comforter (which is the trend in all hotels and many Airbnbs) - I would suggest adding a regular blanket in the closet, which could also be used in the living room since old houses run so cold. Too bad we couldn't utilize the porch, it's quite a bonus.
Noise level was not a problem FYI.
Kitchen is up to date (nice gas stove) but I wouldn't get too ambitious with cooking at home (and few people do when they are vacationing in NOLA), the pots, pans and kitchen ware were very basic. I'm all for non-stick pans but once they get beat up they need to be replaced. The apartment is a bit sparse, but tasteful

review_text:
We had a great stay in this beautiful, spacious apartment. Everything was spotlessly clean (great shower!) and the location is superb, an easy walk to the French Quarter and around the lovely Marigny neighborhood. We had free street parking every day/night beside the house. There are several great breakfast places within a few blocks and, of course, lots of excellent restaurants in the larger area for lunch and dinner. The bakery right underneath the apartment is excellent.
We loved the balcony, although there was a lot of noise at times. On several days, workmen were doing construction work in the park across the street, and at night Frenchmen Street has quite loud traffic. Inside, the house is quiet. In the early morning the balcony was a peaceful place to watch people walking dogs and doing yoga in the park. The many crows in this part of town were fun to watch, as was the squirrel working on a nest high in the trees. Kay was very responsive to a few of our questions.

The interior is truly spectacular (we're already trying to figure out how to replicate the base boards and crown moulding lol), but my absolute favorite spot was on the porch. We're early risers, so watching the some come up through the trees in the park and listening to the birds sing was magical. Frenchmen Street is a bit noisy on Friday & Saturday night, but nothing more than we expected and it doesn't go all night. Within short walking distance was music venues, great coffee, great breakfast, and if you're up for longer walks, the trek over to the garden district is a fun way to burn off a few beignets :) We can't wait to come stay again!

In the evening, the air if filled with the sound of music from Frenchman street (The Spotted Cat, The Blue Nile, Snug Harbor and other venues) just blocks away. It is a part of NOLA on the edge of the French Quarter that will be appreciated by visitors who prefer Frenchman Street to Bourbon Street although the latter is still quite accessible. Both the owner AND property manager are accessible and responsive during our stay which was no less wonderful having been cut short by IDA. This is our new "home away from home" in New Orleans and we will be back.

Spacious bedrooms with ample living space all surrounded by a fantastic balcony that was the focal point of our weekend. review_text: Several reviews mentioned how quiet the location was, but unfortunately our experience was the complete opposite of peaceful. Between the all-day jackhammering in the park, the constant stream of construction and delivery vehicles, and the inebriated people screaming at each other in the middle of the night, we strongly considered moving to a hotel just to get away from the noise. Also, because the first floor is vacant and for lease, there were unhoused residents sitting or sleeping outside our door pretty much the entire duration of our stay. Other reviews are absolutely correct that the inside is beautifully restored and the balcony is lovely, but because we are (apparently) very sensitive to street noise, I am sorry to say we would not stay here again.

review_text: Rodney's place was awesome! Even my hard to please travel companion was satisfied enough to stay an extra day. Rodney was always responsive with our questions and one minor issue. It's a beautifully decorated typical NoLa type shotgun wth all the charm and quirks of 100+ year old houses. If you travel deep in winter, bring your warmer pjs. The location is great: just one street over from Frenchman which is full of restaurants and bars across every price point. The French Quarter is walkable for those in decent shape, but it's a inexpensive ride share hop, too. We never had any problems with parking, although I was careful to stay parked during parade day. Easy access to see most of the walking parades. If you're a light sleeper the front bedroom is along the route between Frenchman and other etertainment spots in the Marighny, so you'll hear folks coming and going. That's part of being in the action, so to speak, so prepare accordingly. Definitely added to our "will stay again" list!

It's in an amazing location, making it super easy to walk to the French Quarter and explore all the streets and shops. Also, just minutes away we had Ayu Bakeshop and SukhoThai which are absolutely amazing and a must try when in NOLA. Parking in the streets was super easy. Rodney's home has lots of character and nicely decorated. Being a great location means you can hear street noises but all the rooms have noise machines which was helpful for our dogs. There is a humid smell which is normal for an old house but having scents would've been nice. If staying with pets, there isn't green area in the patio or in the street but there is a wide strip in the road and a park just a block away. Highly recommend if you want to have a more walkable experience in NOLA.

From traditional jazz to blues, funk, reggae, and everything in between, there is a diverse range of performances happening every night. The music was amazing and the place was right around the corner from it all.

name: Selene
rating_info:
Rating, 3 stars
,
Â·
October 2022
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
I really wanted to like this place but the plumbing smell made it unpleasant. Here is the good and the not so good:
WHAT WORKED
- Location: The location is ideal. I chose this unit because of its proximity to iconic Frenchmen Street and our friend's home (5 mins away). We walked a lot and walking to the French Quarter and street car/public transportation was a breeze from this location. Felt safe and was quiet.
- Eats + People: There are plenty of yummy cafes, bars, and restaurants near the location. Folks were really friendly and we had lots of random conversations with locals and visitors.
- The unit: The beds were comfy, plenty of closet and dresser space, there was nice lighting, TVs in living room and bedroom, the temp in the unit was always nice, there are ACs in the living room and bedroom in the loft section. The kitchen was stocked with pots, pans, utensils, cups and all that. The fridge ran well. Although the unit is old, it is clean.
WHAT DIDN'T WORK
- The smell: There was a plumbing issue that we first thought was a dead animal (thought it was coming from the patio which is why we never went out there) then realized it was coming from the drains in the bathroom (note: the bathroom is very small, the door doesn't close fully, the bathroom drain is not flush to the floor which makes it awkward to navigate while showering, and the water pressure is weak). May as well note: the unit itself is old (part of that NOLA architectural charm) so this is gonna have all the funky little things that old places have: doors that aren't flush with the frames, tall ceilings to mitigate heat, old windows painted shut--none of this bothered me but I imagine in the summer, with bugs, it can be a concern.
Back to the smell: The smell permeated the entire unit. It was awful at times. We noticed that it smelled less when we would run the shower but when we would come back in the afternoon/evening, it reeked as it dried out. We would try to air out the unit and burn incense (note: there is no mesh screen in the security door. It's literally just the frame of the security of the door which kinda doesn't make sense because someone can just reach their hand through and unlock the screen door). Airing out was nearly impossible because we didn't want to leave the front door open and the windows don't open save the small bathroom window.
- Repair work: we were not notified of roofing work on the unit. Our first full day there, we heard sawing, drilling, heavy footsteps on the roof at 8:30am and realized that roofing work was being done on the unit. Ideally there should be no repair work on a unit when guests are staying but if there is, at the very least, inform the guests. Let us know when, what, who, where so we can prepare.
The host was responsive and apologetic but nothing was resolved as the source of the smell was investigated--we just figured out how to mitigate it.
THE HOST
He was nice--it was just an unfortunate circumstance for all involved that soured this stay. He partially refunded (equivalent cost of 1.5 ish days) due to the above issues.
OVERALL
What made this not work for us is resolvable. NOLA is a magical and erratic city that I have visited on a few occasions. The location saved our visit. It was always pleasant to hit the broken pavement (those NOLA streets be cracked and loose and potholed) and meet folks and encounter all the wonderful art and music ever present. I am confident given the above feedback that the host will better communicate with guests by thoughtfully scheduling repair work and now have a better understanding of potential plumbing issues should the stench arise again.
Would I stay here again? Maybe. Would I suggest someone stay here? For the chill and adventurous, given the aforementioned, yes.

The house is beautiful and the owners created a helpful book that shares the home's history and information about the area. The bed was super comfortable and my friend slept well on the sofa bed. Even though the house is just a block from busy Magazine Street, it's very quiet inside. We could have stayed in the neighborhood the entire time with all the nearby shops and restaurants, but we bought a 3-day transit pass and took the St. Charles streetcar into the French Quarter and explored. We had so much fun and are so grateful to have found such a wonderful home away from home.

review_text: First time staying in the Irish Channel. We loved it. The house was exactly as described. We especially liked the authentic feel of the place. On this trip, we met some friends who had never been to New Orleans before. Their city tour got cancelled, and we invited them to check out our Air BNB and eat at Atchafalaya instead of trying to rebook. I think checking out Tim's shotgun house and reading his guidebook gave them a better taste of NOLA history and culture than a city tour could have done. Plus, it was air conditioned and private: bonus! Most shotgun houses are private residences, so it's rare to be able to see inside one of them. I will pick a place like this over a French Quarter or Central Business District hotel every time I stay in New Orleans.

review_text:
Get to know New Orleans from your own beautiful 1880s historic shotgun house! So pretty, with the wood floors, high ceilings, well chosen decor, front porch for people watching, and all spotlessly clean!
Tim was very kind in accommodating our early morning/late evening flights and was always very quick to answer questions. I did extensive research but if you didn't, there's a binder full of anything and everything you might want to do in Nola!
The location is PERFECT, can't stress this enough. It's a 2 min walk from an amazing restaurant, Atchafalaya, and Magazine St. is 2 minutes away as well. The gorgeous Garden district is just on the other side, and beautiful to explore on foot. Do yourself a favor when heading to the French Quarter, walk up Louisiana (lined with beautiful homes) 11 minutes to St. Charles and take the lovely old historic tram car! Ubers home were generally $20 or less. The area's really cute, the house itself is a winner (& great water pressure) we had a great stay

This apartment felt like home. The water pressure in the shower was phenomenal, the heat worked fast despite the high ceilings, it was quiet and private and I felt safe. The kitchen was fully equipped for meal prep and cooking, right down to tupperware containers.
As an able-bodied individual I found the streetcar to be within walking distance, as well as many restaurants, shopping and sightseeing opportunities. A cab/uber to the French Quarter or to Frenchman Street was around $20, and finding the address seemed to be no issue for any of the drivers upon our return each day. I was perfectly happy not having a car staying at this location.
Tim was friendly, helpful and completely responsive. I would definitely stay again!

The apartment (think small house to yourself) in the Irish Channel delivered. Just a block off of Magazine Street, it was super convenient to walk for coffee, lunch, dinner or shopping. The neighborhood is quiet and the houses charming, with plenty of street parking in front. Timâ€™s place is amazing, with 15 foot ceilings, three original fireplaces, beautiful wood floors, and decorated tastefully with great little local culture touches. A full kitchen with anything you need to stay in and cook, a nice coffee bar, and a microwave. The place is also immaculately clean. As a host, Tim was very responsive and helpful in answering our questions. As for value, it was worth every penny. Next time we are in New Orleans, I can only hope it is available again for us. Thanks, Tim!

The amenities in the building (gym and pool) were also nice extras. Check-in was very easy with the keypads on the building and unit. We arrived late at night and left early in the morning and it was clear and easy to get in and out. David was wonderful and communicated so clearly. He also went above and beyond in checking in on us (just in general and in inclement weather). I canâ€™t recommend this place enough for a great stay in New Orleans!

review_text: I booked David's place especially for my parents. The apartment looked better than the listing, the area was great and I do highly recommend it. The only reason I didn't give him all 5's was the week we booked, the building had a problem with gas, rendering the stove and oven unusable. David is a great communicator but failed to inform us of this issue before we booked and arrived at his apartment. The gas was not turned back on during our stay, so David was willing to provide a partial refund. We didn't fully agree on the amount, but overall I still believe David is a great host; we just would've preferred a head's up about the non-working kitchen. New Orleans is a foodie city, but it's nice to have the option to cook a bit, if you desire to do so. All in all, I'm sure this was an anomaly, thus, I highly recommend the apartment to anyone visiting.

Stayed about a week
review_text: This is a great Airbnb in many ways but the location in particular sets it apart. Just a few blocks away from the chaos of the Quarter you have a very quiet oasis at the end of the day. Besides the French Quarter, you could easily walk to the convention center, the outlet mall and the many excellent nearby restaurants. Herbsaint, for example, is less than 200 feet away. Too far to walk? The St Charles streetcar line is just outside to door to take you to the Garden District. One block over it runs the other way to the Quarter and connection at Canal to take you to the city park, art museum, sculpture garden, etc. Inside you will find quality linens, comfortable beds and furniture and a very comfortable living area to talk over the day or tomorrows plans over an evening glass of wine. Both a drip coffee maker and Nespresso are available but be prepared to bring along some coffee. This is our seventh trip to NOLA and this is the bast place to stay we have found. We will be back

We came to NOLA to see BeyoncÃ© and retreat for a few days after, and it was terrific. The host gave clear check-in instructions with photos (helpful for a visual person like me), and our flights arrived well after midnight.
The building is very peaceful, which was wonderful for mid-day naps (aka NOLA hangovers, lol). There are lots of excellent food delivery and walkable spots as well. There is a nice view from the balcony, and the fountain outside adds the perfect touch for early morning/evening sitting.
The space can easily sleep everyone comfortably - even couch-sleeping guests. All appliances worked well
and each bathroom was perfectly stocked with towels and toiletries.
Just make yourself at home, follow the house rules, and you will definitely be booking here again.
Overall, 10/10 would recommend!

If you like to be away from it all but in walking distance, Iâ€™m from Brooklyn so this is totally subjective, then this is the place for you.
If you want to walk outside the front door and be at the party, then this is not the place for you.
Itâ€™s very peaceful, safe, with lots of street parking. There is a parking lot around the corner that we paid on our phone from 10-7, we paid $11 per day. After 7pm, we parked across the street from the building. You choose your own hours to pay for parking. If you choose to park in the buildingâ€™s parking lot, then it will cost you $28 per day.
We lived in Metairie and split our time between there and New Orleans. I would rent this place again because in New Orleans you canâ€™t play with safety.
The place itself was clean, spacious and peaceful. We got what we wanted but we would have preferred to be in Metairie. Thatâ€™s our only complaint which is not a real complaint. :)

We really enjoyed this condo! It is in a great location in the warehouse district, right on the trolley line. It is a short walk to the French Quarter but the neighborhood is quiet. The building as a guard on duty and parking right next door.
The condo met all of our expectations. It was very clean with a simple, modern design. The kitchen had a lot of amenities (garbage bags, coffee, dishwasher soap etc...) and was easy to use. The bedrooms were comfortable (with lots of extra pillows in the closet to choose from) and the bathrooms were modern and clean. It was a little lacking in personality (only two pieces of art in the whole place) but made up for it with comfortable furniture and plenty of throw blankets for movie watching. There is a balcony overlooking an inner courtyard which provided a lot of light into the kitchen and living area. The building had a small outdoor pool which our children enjoyed. We would definitely stay here again!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
I wish I could keep this hidden gem all to myself. Although it is located directly on St. Charles, it's in a quiet part of New Orleans. I arrived during a concert in Lafayette Square (about 20 yards from the front door of the building), and I couldn't hear anything inside the apartment. Neighbors are friendly and quiet. The doormen are great (shoutout to Frank!) and helpful.
The apartment is pristine and well equipped. The beds are very comfortable. The apartment is very quiet internally as well. The walls must be well insulated to dampen sound. I couldn't hear my friend getting ready in the other room. You should have literally everything you need, and if you don't, David and Erika are quick to assist.
You don't really need to leave a three/four black radius when you are there. Rouses and CVS are two blocks north. Great restaurants and bars (Herbsaint, Le Chat Noir, Pluck Wine Bar, Bearcat, Willa Jean) are all within steps. Great stay!

review_text:
WOW!!! What a great place in an even better location!! We will definitely try to reserve Megan's place the next time we travel to NOLA!
Loved relaxing in the morning with our coffee on the back patio, and, on the rare evening we stayed in, we were very comfortable watching TV on the big screen in the living room.
The bedrooms were also very comfortable, as well as quiet. (Tip - during warm weather, set the thermostat fan to "on" to keep warm air from rising to the bedrooms. Much quieter than using the window AC units!)
Everything you need is close by. Lots of great restaurants within easy walking distance, highly recommend Guy's Po-Boys, Apolline, and Superior Seafood & Oyster Bar. Picked up beer and snacks a half block away at Rainbow Grocery.
Thanks again for the perfect "home base" while visiting your wonderful city!!

review_text: A very nice ABnB, spacious, in a great location, walkable to many shops/retaurants/bars, 4 large rooms downstairs + kitchen and half bath. The photos do not capture how large the rooms are. Two bedrooms + full bath upstairs. Confortable furniture/beds, very clean, well maintained. Lotta NOLA themed frames on the walls, music-related and festival frames primary for a great NOLA vibe. No worries about the Magazine Street location, it's a decently trafficed street, but very quiet inside the house, the bedrooms are in the back, and you can't hear the street. Being on Magazine Street is a bonus, great restaurants, bars and shops in short walking distance, such a great NOLA showcase street without the tourist throngs of the French Quarter. Over 4 days, never had a problem finding a parking spot out front. Megan/Jonathan live next door - while they were quick to respond to contacts, they were very respectful of our privacy. This is high value stay at a decent price.

review_text: This home was perfect for our NOLA vacation! The place was spotless, the decor was fun and stylish, and the kitchen was well stocked. We were in awe of the super tall ceilings both upstairs and down, and the house had lots of character and unique touches. The bedrooms were both really nice (no fighting over the better room!) and they are set back from the street so we didn't hear any road noise. The stairs to the bedrooms were a little skinny and steep but didn't bother us at all. There were lots of shops, restaurants, and bars within walking distance, and the Magazine bus (1/2 block) and streetcar (6 blocks) both conveniently run straight to the French Quarter. Check-in was easy and the hosts who live next door were very friendly, responsive, and provided some great recommendations. All in all this place was fantastic and we would definitely stay here again.

review_text:
Absolutely top notch! Megan's place is the place to stay if you're looking to experience and fall in love with New Orleans!
To start, the house is located on Magazine St. which is a wonderful avenue full of shops and eateries. But, because it is not located in the middle of the hustle and bustle, it is a quieter retreat amongst mature trees and within walking distance of activity and excitement. Parking was absolutely no issue. Further, the house is a true gem! If you want to experience a historical camelback shotgun house, Megan's is the one! The front of the home has a lovely porch for relaxing at any time of the day. Inside, Megan has decorated the space in such a classy and functional manner that it was frankly hard to choose whether we enjoyed staying inside or outside! The bedrooms were comfortable as well, which was fantastic after long days of exploring. Megan was even nice enough to leave coffee, beverages, and a frozen pizza! Finally, we were able to bring our pups along with us! The front porch/garden is gated which allowed us to hang out without having to leash our dogs and the house is within walking distance from a dog park and many dog friendly restaurants.
Megan's place is truly 5 stars all around from location, to comfort, to some thoughtful personal touches... absolutely second to none. We hope to stay here many more times to come!

You could easily spend a weekend only walking around and eating within the Garden District and have a great time. It's pretty easy to get to downtown or the French Quarter by public transportation and it's very affordable to get there by rideshare. The street is well lit and even during the weekdays there's a fair amount of foot traffic. So we felt safe walking around after dark. All in all, I would absolutely book this unit again!

The loft style bedroom was a great way to separate the sleeping area from the rest of the suite. The linens were of beautiful quality, as were the towels, dishes, and glassware.
Catherine is incredibly responsive, accommodating, and kind. She was able to supply us with a small freezer (Iâ€™m a nursing mom) and even left a sweet gift for our little one. If we find ourselves back in NOLA, we will most certainly ask to stay again.

This was a gem of a place! It is small but feels spacious. And it is sooo quiet! There was some construction going on in the area but it was very muted in the rental. It was my first airb&b stay, and as a senior woman on her own, I felt very secure here. Catherine was very responsive with pointers on transportation and dining (and how to use the lock system on the door and run the cooling system). I was appreciative of the two air temp systems. My sonâ€™s family stayed at a lovely established French Quarter hotel for 4 nights that never had working air conditioning!
Magazine Street is nearby and the whole neighborhood features some of the lovely architecture New Orleans is known for. I wish I had had more leisure time to spend meandering. I had a very busy schedule of wedding-related events and the hostâ€™s extra-considerate provisions of water, snack bars, coffee (with half and halfâ€”important!) and protein shakes kept me going before the Uber arrived to sweep me away. I did go out and get some delicious local Greek food on my first night.
I would highly recommend this host!

They made our stay very comfortable. As natives, they had many helpful suggestions on restaurants etc. In my opinion this AirBnb could not be located in a better place in New Orleans! You are very close to a bustling part of Magazine St. with all it's antique/vintage shops, cute boutiques, restaurants and coffee houses. It is (6) blocks from the St. Charles Streetcar line which will take you either uptown or downtown towards the CBD (Center Business District), Warehouse District, and French Quarter. The guest suite itself is very comfortable, quiet, clean and newly renovated. It has it's own back entrance so you don't feel you're disrupting the homeowners as you come and go from the suite.

It's surrounded by local bars and restaurants within a couple of blocks in every direction . The airbnb was surprisingly more spacious than how it looks in the picture and very charming.
Most of all, the host was very responsive and one of the most accommodating host out there. I definitely would stay here again in the future.

review_text:
Robert was an all star host. He was immediately responsive anytime I required assistance. The place was in a great location a few blocks from the French Quarter, but still was quite and felt very safe walking home late at night and leaving our car parked in front. There was water to drink and some snacks available for getting home late after a long night on the Quarter. The restaurants within one block were all great, a coffee shop with ice cream, and a spot for bloody marys and brunch with great yelp reviews and quality dishes.
The place was even more roomy than in the photos. Which was a nice surprise. It has a kitchen, bathroom, master and then two more rooms with couches if more space is needed. The quality of the place itself was not perfect, a bit old feeling, but for the price it can't be beat, which is why it averages out to five stars in my opinion.

Stayed one night
review_text: Never having been to New Orleans, researching location was challenging and I wondered right up until arrival if I had made the right choice. Robert's place worked out to have the perfect balance of walking distance to everything but just enough distance to be a quiet neighborhood to stay in. I walked the distance and If you graphed the French Quarter from The East (Robert house) to the West (Hotels and high rises) it's a steady slope from peaceful to chaos. The neighborhood felt safe and I had no problem parking out front, day or night. Inside the "shotgun duplex" is a uniquely wonderful structure transitioning from room to room without hallways. Tastefully decorated and comfortable from couches to beds that were all in great shape. The kitchen was set up nicely and the full size coffee maker was a treat. The place oozes with charm. Don't pass this one up.

review_text: This home is one of the most thoughtful and detail-oriented stays I've had in quite a while. Robert is a hospitality professional and deeply ingrained in his community, and his home shows off both these qualities. The stay is a 4-room shotgun-style house with two living areas, one bedroom, and a full kitchen (except for stove). It is clean, charming, and quiet. The home has multiple options for cooling with many fans and AC. The location is a quick walk both from the French Quarter and Bywater - with this home base, you can see everything a visitor would want to see on foot. Robert was a great host, his home is wonderful - you should stay here!

Parking can be a pain in the middle of New Orleans, but this spot is a great combination of a great walking location and ease of parking. I'll snatch this one up next time if it's available!

OMG... Don't let the simple appearance of the outside of this little White House fool ya... it is fantastic! Very close to a coffee shop and a market... within Walking distance to the French Quarter a d Bourbon street... so close enough to the parties, Yet quiet and relaxing. My friend and I(both females) were traveling together and at no time felt unsafe.
It felt much more like staying at a friend's house that staying at a hotel! It has so much character...
Do yourself a favor and venture into the back yard! It was like a surprising paradise back there.
If I ever go back to NOLA... Robert's place will certainly be my first choice!!! I highly recommend!

review_text: Roberts home is located in an amazing area, that makes you feel more like a local and less like a tourist. In easy walking distance to Frenchman street where there is live music, art, and great food! About a 15-20 minute walk into the French Quarter as well. The house was beautiful- clean and comfortable! We loved that the kitchen had plates, silverware, coffeemaker etc- it helped us to save a little money and enjoy a few meals in during our stay. There was also a lush backyard with a nice sitting area. I highly recommend staying here, especially if you enjoy walking/ biking around while you travel- perfect location to do so!

review_text:
Robert was a wonderful, responsive host who went above and beyond . He welcome me when I arrived and took the time to chat with me a number of times during my 1 day visit. When I had questions about the apartment he responded immediately.
Most importantly after leaving and halfway to the airport I sheepishly realized I'd lost my coat & keys running for the bus. Robert graciously found them for me (in the middle of the street!), met me at the bus stop when I got back, and waited with me for the bus to return even though it was rather chilly out.
Because of Robert and his fabulous apartment I had the opportunity to relax and unwind after an intense business meeting and had a happy ending to what could have been a disastrous trip.
